Package chess_game

Class King

  • java.lang.Object
    • chess_game.Piece
      • chess_game.King
  • public class King
extends Piece
    Each team begins with and can have a maximum of 1 King. The King is the most important piece on a team, as it's defeat is the sole way for an opponent to achieve victory. The King can move in any linear direction, but can only move one space at a time (except when castling). If the King is in a square that is under attack by an enemy piece, the King is "in check". The player's next move must take the King out of check, either by moving the king or preventing the attacker from attacking. If the King cannot be taken out of check in a single move, Checkmate is achieved and the opponent wins the game.

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void castle​(Rook r)
      Requires both the Rook in question and the allied King to have hasMoved be False, the King to have inCheck be False, the spaces between the Rook and King to be empty, and the spaces the king passes through must be free of attack by enemies.

      • castle

        public void castle​(Rook r)
        Requires both the Rook in question and the allied King to have hasMoved be False, the King to have inCheck be False, the spaces between the Rook and King to be empty, and the spaces the king passes through must be free of attack by enemies. Moves the King two spaces towards the Rook, and moves the Rook to the space the King just crossed through (ie if the King moves left 2 spaces, the Rook moves 1 space right of the King) Sets hasMoved to True for both King and Rook.
        Parameters:
        r - The Rook being used in this move.
